body_html: I looked at it but haven't thought about it much yet. There's code right now on master that prevents a 0-dim tensor from going into torch.cat (did we have 0-dim tensors in pytorch 0.3?), but it can still take empty tensors (tensor.dim() == 1 and tensor.numel() == 0) that have been causing issues: #5332 #5739
body_text: I looked at it but haven't thought about it much yet. There's code right now on master that prevents a 0-dim tensor from going into torch.cat (did we have 0-dim tensors in pytorch 0.3?), but it can still take empty tensors (tensor.dim() == 1 and tensor.numel() == 0) that have been causing issues: #5332 #5739
body: I looked at it but haven't thought about it much yet. There's code right now on master that prevents a 0-dim tensor from going into `torch.cat` (did we have 0-dim tensors in pytorch 0.3?), but it can still take empty tensors (`tensor.dim() == 1 and tensor.numel() == 0`) that have been causing issues: #5332 #5739
